intro: Paeonia commutata, commonly known as the meadow peony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and are typically borne on tall, erect stems. The plant has palmate leaves composed of 5–11 pointed leaflets, and its roots are thick and fleshy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in prairies and open woods. Paeonia commutata is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
